title: User Registration with Valid Data
description: Verify that a user can successfully register with valid email, strong password, valid phone number, and required documents based on the selected plan.

steps.description: Navigate to the registration form page.
Input a valid email address, a strong password meeting complexity requirements, a valid phone number, and upload required documents.
Submit the registration form.
Check that the registration is successful and the user receives initial credits.

title: User Registration with Invalid Email
description: Ensure registration fails if the email format is invalid.

steps.description: Navigate to the registration form page.
Input an invalid email format with other valid details.
Submit the registration form.
Verify that the system shows an appropriate validation error for the email field.

title: User Login with Valid Credentials
description: Verify that users can log in successfully using correct credentials and receive a valid JWT token.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter valid email and password credentials.
Click the login button.
Verify login is successful and a JWT token is issued and stored.

title: User Login with Invalid Credentials
description: Ensure that login fails gracefully with invalid username or password.

steps.description: Navigate to the login page.
Enter invalid email or password.
Click the login button.
Verify the login attempt fails with an appropriate error message.

title: JWT Token Expiry and Refresh
description: Verify that JWT tokens expire as expected and can be refreshed correctly to maintain session.

steps.description: Login to obtain a valid JWT token.
Wait until the token expiration time passes.
Attempt to access a protected resource with the expired token.
Verify that access is denied due to token expiration.
Use the refresh token endpoint to obtain a new JWT token.
Access the protected resource again with the refreshed token.
Verify access is granted with the new token.

title: Add Chip via QR Code Scan - Business Plan Limit
description: Verify that users with BUSINESS plan can add chips up to the allowed limit and receive proper error on exceeding the limit.

steps.description: Login as a BUSINESS plan user.
Navigate to the add chip page and scan QR code for chip registration until limit is reached.
Verify all allowed chips are successfully added and each chip status is updated correctly.
Attempt to add one more chip beyond the plan limit.
Verify that the system presents an error preventing chip addition beyond plan limits.

title: Chip Status Monitoring Real-Time
description: Verify real-time status updates of connected chips on the chips management dashboard.

steps.description: Login and navigate to the chips management page.
Observe chip statuses immediately after adding, disconnecting, and reconnecting chips.
Verify that the UI reflects status changes in real-time without manual page refresh.

title: Chip Maturation Automatic Heat-up Process (BUSINESS/ENTERPRISE)
description: Validate that the chip maturation process heats up chips gradually as per configuration to minimize ban risks.

steps.description: Login as BUSINESS or ENTERPRISE user with chips assigned.
Start chip maturation process.
Verify chips increase messaging activity gradually over time according to system schedule.
Verify no chip is assigned excessive load initially.

title: Chip Rotation Automatic Distribution
description: Verify the automated chip rotation and distribution strategy works correctly with message sending in campaigns.

steps.description: Create a campaign for message sending with multiple chips active.
Configure rotation parameters and start the campaign.
Verify that messages are distributed evenly among chips according to rotation strategy.
Verify that chip overload or ban risks are minimized by rotation.

title: Create Campaign with Contact Import and Message Editor
description: Test campaign creation process including import of contacts, use of message editor with variables, and media attachment.

steps.description: Login and navigate to campaign creation wizard.
Fill in basic data for the campaign.
Import contacts via CSV or manual input.
Use message editor to compose message with variable placeholders and upload media files.
Complete configuration and confirm campaign creation.
Verify campaign is stored with accurate data, contacts, and message content.

title: Campaign Lifecycle: Start, Pause, Cancel, Monitor
description: Validate the full lifecycle of a campaign including starting, pausing, cancelling and monitoring status with instant feedback.

steps.description: Navigate to an existing created campaign.
Start the campaign and verify delivery begins.
Verify real-time monitoring reflects campaign progress and sent message count.
Pause the campaign.
Verify that sending halts and status updates accordingly.
Resume the campaign.
Verify message sending resumes correctly.
Cancel the campaign.
Verify campaign is marked cancelled and sending stops permanently.

title: Sending Messages Respecting Plan Limits and Intervals
description: Check that messages are sent adhering to the configured minimum interval and limits set by the user's subscription plan.

steps.description: Create a campaign with message sending settings specifying intervals.
Start the campaign and monitor sending behavior.
Verify that messages are spaced no closer than the minimum interval.
Verify sending does not exceed the user's plan message limits.

title: Report Generation with Multiple Export Formats
description: Verify that reports can be generated, viewed, and exported accurately in PDF, CSV, Excel, and JSON formats.

steps.description: Navigate to the reports section.
Select a report type and configure parameters.
Generate the report and export in PDF, CSV, Excel, and JSON formats.
Verify the exported files contain accurate and complete data as displayed.

title: In-App and Email Notification Delivery
description: Verify notifications triggered for important events such as low credits, chip status changes, and campaign updates are shown in-app and sent via email when configured.

steps.description: Trigger events like credits falling below threshold or campaign completion.
Verify corresponding notifications appear in the in-app notification center.
Verify notification emails are received in configured email inbox.

title: Webhook Integration for ENTERPRISE Plan
description: Verify webhook events are sent correctly for configured triggers for ENTERPRISE users.

steps.description: Login as ENTERPRISE user and configure webhook URL and events.
Trigger the configured events, such as campaign start or completion.
Verify webhooks are dispatched with correct payloads and status code 200 responses are handled.

title: API REST Authentication and Rate Limiting
description: Test that the REST API requires API Key authentication and enforces rate limits properly for ENTERPRISE plan.

steps.description: Make an API request with a valid API Key.
Verify the API responds successfully with requested data.
Make an API request with invalid or missing API Key.
Verify access is denied with appropriate error.
Perform rapid successive API calls exceeding rate limits.
Verify the API rejects requests beyond rate limits with rate limit error.

title: Data Security and Encryption at Rest
description: Verify that sensitive user data and credentials are stored encrypted in the database and secure against unauthorized access.

steps.description: Retrieve database records of user accounts.
Verify password hashes and sensitive fields are stored encrypted and not in plain text.

title: Frontend Responsiveness and Accessibility
description: Test the web interface responsiveness on multiple device screen sizes and accessibility of key components with keyboard and screen readers.

steps.description: Open key frontend pages on desktops, tablets, and smartphones.
Verify layout adjusts correctly and remains fully functional on all screen sizes.
Navigate using keyboard controls only.
Verify all interactive components are accessible and keyboard focus is visible and logical.
Use a screen reader to navigate UI elements.
Verify appropriate ARIA attributes and labels are present for screen reader comprehension.

title: Loading, Success, and Error UI States
description: Verify that the UI consistently shows visual feedback states for loading, success, and error in the user flows.

steps.description: Trigger actions like form submission, data fetching, and message sending.
Verify loading indicators appear during processing.
Verify success messages and confirmation states are shown on completion.
Force error states (e.g., network failure) and verify error messages are displayed clearly.
